title: Apple Data Platform - Engineering Manager, Data Solution Platform
summary: The Apple Data Platform team powers data analytics, exploration, and feature engineering to power Siri, Search, Music, iCloud and many other products we all love in our Apple ecosystem.
description: Join Apple's Data Platform team as an Engineering Manager to deliver the best experiences across a multitude of Apple products from Siri, Spotlight, Music, TV and Safari.
key_qualifications: 8+ years of software development experience, 3+ years managing engineering teams for Data Processing or similar area, Experience with commercial and/or open-source large-scale data processing, storage frameworks, and platforms such as Apache Spark, Experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, Rust, Experience in managing and optimizing data platforms and infrastructure, Strong organizational skills and experience working in large multi-functional teams, Experience in influencing and driving key product innovations and opportunities across diverse collaborators, Passionate about operational excellence through proper automation and engineering processes, Strong distributed systems and engineering background, Superb problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
education_experience: B.S or M.S. Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent work experience
additional_requirements: Bonus if you have experience in the following areas: Working with streaming data processing frameworks such as Apache Flink, Kafka Streams, Spark Streaming, Working with data visualization tools such as Apache Superset, Grafana, Working with interactive computing platforms such as Jupyter Notebook, Developing and optimizing algorithms that run efficiently on resource-constrained platforms
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between $190,700 and $329,600, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs.
